contentrichtext.text: '''Edward''', '''Ed''' or '''Eddie Williams''' may refer to: {{tocright}} ==In sports== *[[Edward Gordon Williams]] (1888–1915), British rower *[[Edward Williams (cricketer, born 1892)]], English cricketer *[[Edward Williams (footballer)]], soccer player *[[Edward Williams (cricketer, born 1925)]], English cricketer *[[Ed Williams (American football)]] (born 1950), American football player for the Cincinnati Bengals and Tampa Bay Buccaneers *[[Eddie Williams (baseball)]] (born 1964), American baseball player of the 1980s and 1990s *[[Edward Williams (American football)]] (born 1982), American football player *[[Eddie Williams (American football)]] (born 1987), American football fullback for the Washington Redskins and Chicago Bears ==In the military== *[[Edward Ellerker Williams]] (1793–1821), British Army officer *[[Edward Williams (British Army officer)]] (1892–1977), British Army officer and cricketer *[[Edward Thomas Williams]] (1901–1973), Lieutenant General in the United States Army *[[Edward Alexander Wilmot Williams]] (1910–1994), British general ==In government== *[[Edward Williams (died c.1594)]], MP *[[Edward Williams (UK politician)]] (1890–1963), British politician and diplomat *[[Eddie Joe Williams]] (born 1954), American politician in Arkansas ==In the law== *[[Edward Vaughan Williams]] (1797–1875), English judge *[[Edward Williams (Victorian judge)]] (1813–1880), judge from Victoria, Australia *[[Edward Bennett Williams]] (1920–1988), American lawyer and sports team owner *[[Edward Williams (Queensland judge)]] (1921–1999), judge from Queensland, Australia ==Others== *[[Iolo Morganwg]] (real name Edward Williams, 1747–1826), Welsh antiquarian *[[Edward Williams (engraver)]] (c.1755–1797?), English engraver *[[Edward Williams (painter)]] (1781–1855), English painter *[[Edward Leader Williams]] (1828–1910), English engineer *[[Edward Christopher Williams]] (1871–1929), American librarian *[[Edward Charles Williams]] (1807–1881), English landscape painter *[[Edward Francis Williams]] (1903–1970), British newspaper editor *[[Edward Williams (businessman)]] (1843–1903), American businessman who co-founded the Sherwin-Williams Company *[[Edward Wyckoff Williams]] (born 1978), African-American author and political and economic analyst *[[Ed Williams (actor)]], American actor *[[Eddie Williams (saxophonist)]] (born 1910), American musician *[[Edward Williams (minister)]] (1750–1813), Welsh nonconformist minister, theological writer, and tutor ==See also== *[[Edwin Williams]] (born 1986), American football offensive lineman for the Chicago Bears *[[Edwin Williams (rugby)]] (1898–1983), rugby union and rugby league footballer of the 1920s for Wales (RU), Neath, Wales (RL), and Huddersfield *[[Ted Williams (disambiguation)]] *{{Lookfrom}} {{hndis|Williams, Edward}}
